intro: Ornithogalum comosum var. atlanticum, commonly known as the Atlantic star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers in early spring. The plant belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and naturalized areas.
